11.m: The thief comes only to steal and kill and destroy. I came that they may have life and have it abundantly. - John 10:10 (ESV)

l.q: Form the Bible reading, to whom did Jesus liken himself?
l.a: Jesus likened himself to a good shepherd. He has authority over His sheep. He knows His sheep, He even knows thm by name. And His sheep knows Him too, and it is He that they follow.

l.q: Which verses speak of Jesus being the savior of His sheep?
l.a: In verses 9-11, Jesus speaks of being the door where those who enter will be saved and will have abundant life. In contrast to the thief who only comes to steal and kill and destroy. Jesus lays down his life for the sheep.

The sheep are those people who follow Jesus. Jesus speaks of other sheep who are not of this fold, but He will bring them also with Him. Israel is God's chosen people, but later on God caused the gospel to also spread to the Gentiles.

s.h:
Pleased as man with men to dwell 
 Jesus, our Emmanuel

11.a: Enjoy a cup of warm chocolate or apple cider with someone who lives with you.
